page.title: 14RESULTS FROM A QUESTIONAIRE
page.content: TO GAIN AN INSIGHT INTO THE LIVES OF LOCAL PEOPLE A QUESTIONAIRE WAS GIVEN TO A REPRESENTATIVE SAMPLE OF THE INHABITANTS OF BOYLESTONE.THE FOLLOWING ARE CONCLUSIONS DRAWN FROM THE SURVEY. MORE PEOPLE OWNED HOUSES OR FARMS RATHER THAN RENTING THEM,WHICH PROVES THAT THE MAJORITY HAVE A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF MONEY.NEARLY ALL OF THE 11 PEOPLE QUESTIONED OWNED A CAR,AND MOST OF THEM HAD ENOUGH MONEY TO AFFORD A HOLIDAY.TWO PEOPLE WENT TO EUROPE,ONE TO THE U.S.A.AND THE REST STAYED IN THE BRITISH ISLES.FOUR PEOPLE DIDN'T GO ON HOLIDAY AND THREE OF THESE HAVE LIVED IN BOYLESTONE FOR OVER SIXTY YEARS AND SO THEIR AGE MIGHT DETER THEM FROM TRAVELLING.ALSO THREE OF THE PEOPLE OWNED FARMS WHICH MAY HAVE MADE IT DIFFICULT TO HOLIDAY.THE PEOPLE INTERVIEWED HAD ALL LIVED IN
